unnormalised: Beyond engine technology, factors like tire pressure and driving habits significantly impact fuel consumption. Maintaining proper tire inflation and avoiding aggressive acceleration can improve fuel economy by up to 15%.

unnormalised: Even seemingly small changes, like reducing idling time and removing unnecessary weight (e.g., rooftop carriers), can make a difference. Remember that your grandmother’s advice about driving smoothly still holds true! Considering the large population and sprawling cities of India, even slight improvements can dramatically reduce overall emissions. Efficient urban planning, including creating more green spaces exceeding 10,000 sq ft, is also a key component of a greener future.
